chapter.title: Sign Up and Log In
chapter.para: Before you can develop applications for &PRODUCTABBR;, you need a developer account and the URLs and credentials for accessing your developer resources. The sections that follow step you through signing up for an account and logging in to access those resources.

section.title: Sign up for a Developer Account
section.para: In the &COMPANYABBR;-hosted Sandbox development environment, you register for an account from the &COMPANYABBR; Sandbox Developer Page. Once you have a Sandbox account, you can also use this account to access the &PRODUCTABBR; Production environment.
Use the following steps to sign up for a developer account with an &COMPANYABBR;-hosted Sandbox:

step.para: Open a web browser, go to the Sandbox Developer Page, and click Sandbox Registration from the menu at the left.
Complete and submit the registration form.
Read and accept the terms of use and privacy policy.
After you receive a verification email from &COMPANYABBR;, click the link in that email to activate your account.
Once you confirm your email address, you will receive a second email with important information about your account, including the Web address to use when logging in to your Sandbox.

section.title: Log In to the Sandbox
section.para: During your developer registration, you should receive an email with the URL to use to log in and get started with your Sandbox. This includes the address to your Sandbox. If you're using the &COMPANYABBR; hosted Sandbox, this is https://portal.&HOSTEDSANDBOX;.

Only authenticated users with appropriate rights are allowed to view or modify data. All SLI resources in the &COMPANYABBR; system are secured using LDAP authentication, role-based security rights, and context-specific access controls. Because of this security, you must start each Sandbox session by signing in appropriately.
For more information about how to sign in to the Sandbox to test applications, see .
To log in and complete the setup of your Sandbox, use the following steps:

step.para: Using your preferred Web browser, navigate to the Sandbox URL.
Enter your developer account credentials and click Login.
If this is your first access to the Sandbox, or if you are accessing it after a recent upgrade to the software license, click Agree to accept the License Agreement.
Click Admin to access links to the system tools you need for performing administrative tasks, including additional setup steps.
To complete your Sandbox setup, do both of the following. Each task is covered in its own chapter to follow:

listitem.para: Add sample data to the Secure Data Service - The &RESTAPI; cannot return data if you do not have any to return. To upload sample data to your Sandbox, such as one of the free sample data sets from &COMPANYABBR;, follow the procedures in .

Register your application in the Sandbox - To perform secure transactions with the &RESTAPI;, your application will need client ID and shared secret values to authenticate with &PRODUCTABBR;. These values are set up when you register the application in the &PRODUCTABBR;. You don't have to have the application running yet in order to do this, and you can update this registration with new information when you do. To register an application in your Sandbox environment, follow the procedures in .

section.title: Log In to Production
section.para: You can use the account you created in the Sandbox to log in to the &PRODUCTABBR; Production environment, where you can register your application for use.

step.para: Using your preferred Web browser, navigate to the &COMPANYABBR; Production URL.
Sign in using the credentials for your Sandbox application developer account.
Once you log in to Production, you can register you application for use. For more information about registering your application in Production, see .
